keywords.value: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Gynecologic Oncology Unit at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center of New York City (Play)
keywords.name: creative_works

lead_paragraph: This play depicts the scabrous wit of a woman and a man who get to know each other when their cancer-afflicted mothers share a hospital room.

headline.print_headline: Bedside Vigil With a Surefire Punch Line
headline.main: Review: ‘A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Gynecologic Oncology Unit’ Blends Rage With Gallows Humor

snippet: This play depicts the scabrous wit of a woman and a man who get to know each other when their cancer-afflicted mothers share a hospital room.
abstract: Ben Brantley reviews MCC Theater production of Halley Feiffer play A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Gynecologic Oncology Unit at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center of New York, directed by Trip Cullman, at Lucille Lortel Theater.
